DOC.brief_summary: This project examine whether theory-based telephone intervention deliver nurse time woman inform abnormal Pap test result increase adherence follow-up recommendation .
DOC.brief_title: Intervention Improve Follow-up Abnormal Pap Test
DOC.detailed_description: Over 90 % death due cervical cancer could prevent appropriate screening treatment precursor lesion . However , 20 % 70 % woman United States tell Papanicolaou ( Pap ) test abnormal adhere recommendation follow-up care . This problem especially among minority woman low socioeconomic status . The purpose part protocol test theory-based intervention design improve adherence follow-up among woman experience abnormal Pap test . The intervention message , deliver telephone nurse , time Pap test result give patient . The investigator propose randomize woman experience abnormal Pap test one three group : ( 1 ) target cultural belief + knowledge + importance message ( intervention ) , ( 2 ) nontargeted belief + knowledge + importance ( active control ) , ( 3 ) standard care ( passive control ) . All three group receive standard care , notify woman telephone abnormal result provide instruction follow-up . Women assign intervention group also receive cultural belief component consistent racial/ethnic group , detail information follow-up procedure consequence return follow-up , information regard importance adhere recommendation , particularly `` low grade '' abnormality . Women assign active control group receive nontargeted belief component , plus procedural knowledge message importance follow-up . Adherence initial follow-up primary outcome . Other behavioral outcome , delay care completeness care , also assess 18-month interval chart review . Additionally , investigator evaluate psychological outcome include anxiety distress . Finally , investigator examine grade abnormality ( low versus high ) effect modifier . The investigator anticipate research result intervention improve several important behavioral psychological outcome relate abnormal Pap test result . The intervention guide general integrative theoretical framework ; therefore , research evaluate intervention strategy recognize importance target culturally relevant belief follow-up key determinant behavior ( knowledge/skills , salience , environmental constraint ) surround abnormal Pap test result . Ultimately , objective research improve adherence follow-up among low-income , minority woman particular risk develop cervical cancer .
DOC.criteria: Women age 18 55 year present University Texas Medical Branch ( UTMB ) clinic Pap test . Women currently pregnant Have current diagnosis cervical cancer ; Who unable understand English Spanish .
